short_summary: The National Research Council of Canada is seeking bids for an Imaged Capillary Electrophoresis System for use in research and development.
description: The contract involves the supply of an Imaged Capillary Electrophoresis System (Scan) which must be able to perform imaged capillary electrophoresis separations. The instrument must be able to do both charge-based and size-based separations. The imaging detector must be able to measure both absorbance and fluorescence. The autosampler must be able to inject samples from vials and do on-board mixing immediately before injection. The system must include software that controls the instrument, processes data, and generates reports. The contractor must also provide installation, manuals, training, maintenance and support services, and an optional extended warranty. The contract is subject to the Canada-Honduras Free Trade Agreement and other trade agreements. A statement of capabilities may be submitted from suppliers who consider themselves fully qualified and available to provide the goods, services, or construction services described in the ACAN. The closing date for submitting a statement of capabilities is October 11th, 2023 at 2:00 pm EDT.

# Government Tender Announcement: Imaged Capillary Electrophoresis System
### Solicitation Number: 23_58119
### Publication Date: 2023-09-26
### Closing Date: 2023-10-11T14:00:00
### Amendment Date: 2023-10-11
### Expected Contract Start Date: None
### Expected Contract End Date: None

The National Research Council Canada is soliciting bids for the supply of an imaged capillary electrophoresis system. The scope of work includes the supply and delivery of the equipment, as well as installation, integration, and configuration of all associated materials.

### Key Requirements

* The imaged capillary electrophoresis system must be capable of performing:
	+ Imaged cIEF analysis and CE-SDS analysis on the same instrument
	+ Charge-based and size-based separations
	+ Autosampler with on-board mixing immediately before injection
* The system must have an imaging detector that can measure absorbance and fluorescence
* Waste must be self-contained in a closed system within the instrument
* The contractor must provide software that controls the instrument, processes data, and generates reports
* Installation, integration, and configuration of the system must be completed within 16 weeks of confirmation of order
* The contractor must provide manuals, training, maintenance and support services, and optional extended warranty

### Trade Agreements

This procurement is subject to the following trade agreements:

* Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)
* Revised World Trade Organization - Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO-AGP)
* Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA)
* Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP)
* Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement (CCFTA)
* Canada-Colombia Free Trade Agreement
* Canada-Honduras Free Trade Agreement
* Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement
* Canada-Panama Free Trade Agreement
* Canada-Peru Free Trade Agreement (CPFTA)
* Canada-United Kingdom Trade Continuity Agreement (Canada-UK TCA)
* Canada-Ukraine Free Trade Agreement (CUFTA)
